title: Is Kennen Worth Picking Up?
body: Is Kennen a good pick or should I not pick him?

replies.body:
Would suggest watching Game 2 of this series: http://www.lolesports.com/en_US/lck/lck_2016_spring/matches/regular_season/ROX-vs-KT

I always just play a couple games on a champion. See if last hitting feels good, see if I like their pattern and high moments (ultimate).  Good luck.

I apologize for being one of the ongo bongo me go face bring back urf posters, but i really would like riot to acknowledge the community's outrage instead of just ignoring it, you guys don't have to bring urf back (although i would like it if you did) but it would really be nice if you guys could at least affirmatively say you're not bringing it back.

http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/gameplay/announcing-rotating-game-mode-queue

Read it and stop bugging the reds.

Playable in *four* positions.  (all but jungle)

Very fun, variable build paths, pretty easy to pick up.

Not my favorite champion, but definitely one of the healthier kits in the game.

I mean he looks like he don't weigh more than 30lbs, so its probably not that hard to *pick him up*.
huehue

Anywho....
Yeh, he's fairly easy to learn, fairly forgiving (low cds other than his ulti, decent escape, no mana so you can sorta just poke stuff out and see if it works..) can build both ad and ap, and is in some pro play so he'll be viable at least sometimes/some team comps in all elo's. No real reason not to try him out.
That's a pretty vague question. Depends on what you are picking for, and your play style I suppose.

Kennen is a very expensive (6300 i think, highest cost) champ but worth every dollar, if u use his abilities right he is powerful, and he can make quick escapes. He is one of the most fun people 2 play though
{{champion:85}}

Absolutely.
I main Kennen for a couple of reasons:

1. Very good at all stages in the game. In early you are a bit of a bully to people, in mid you roam and excel at skirmishes and teamfights, and late game you can singlehandedly win the teamfight to win the game.
2. He's a bit hard to play at first, but once you learn him, he is incredibly useful and good to know.
3. Even if you feed and fall behind, he has a fallback: his stun will always be around, regardless of how much you've fed, and you still have a use in teamfights.
Hes good in low elo, aoe cc is always a good choice. Also farming with him is quite easy.

Kennen is a great pick with his burst potential. He's also very flexible as you can pick him in any role but the jungle.

Very fun champion and he's personally one of my mains as well. He has great stuns, an excellent ult that works well in any teamfight and is a highly interactive champion. Try him out whenever you get the chance - he could be worth your time depending on your own playstyle as he's quite different compared to most other champions.
kennen can single handedly win team fights. high burst. can be played both ap and ad (as an ad carry). and he counters zed and most all in assassins

i've played him mid and top whe he was fotm, i did rlly good with him. and than i played him adc so hes my main. i'd say yes. mid and top ar easy but adc is a bit harder so it depends on what role you want o play him
I haven't played him much, but I had alot of fun the few times I did when he was free. Don't buy him without trying him out first, unless you're gonna be devoted to playing and learning him.
